newsitem.title: TURKEY: Police, students clash at Istanbul protest.
newsitem.headline: Police, students clash at Istanbul protest.

text.p: Turkish police clashed with students on a protest march in Istanbul on Friday and detained 150 people, the state-run Anatolian news agency said.

Private NTV television showed pictures of several dozen police beating students with batons, on one occasion piling some of them up on a street corner and hitting and kicking them en masse. Some students, nursing wounds, could be seen running away as others were collected up to be detained.
NTV said the students were demonstrating against an incident on Thursday when police fired guns during a clash between rightist and leftist students.
Anatolian said police intervened in the march by Istanbul university students, detaining 150 people. The detainees were taken to be questioned by anti-terror police.
The marginal leftist Labour Party said in a statement that the police was siding with rightist students in the fighting.
"There is no rightist-leftist fighting in universities, just fascist attacks," the statement said.
"And the police are acting like an organ of the MHP (the far-right Nationalist Action Party)."
